direct_answer.text:
On Monday, if Christopher works through X problems, this leaves him with \(100 - X\) problems remaining to complete by Friday. According to condition three, on Tuesday morning, he completes three times the number he did on Monday, which means he completes \(3X\). Therefore, at the start of Wednesday, he would still need to resolve \((100 - X) - 3X\) problems, simplifying to \(100 - 4X\).

According to condition four, by the time it gets dark on Wednesday evening, Christopher has finished exactly half of these leftover tasks. Hence, he resolves \(\frac{1}{2} \times (100 - 4X)\) additional problems over Wednesday afternoon and into early evening. To find out how many remain untouched leading up to Thursday midday, one could write down the equation representing the situation post midweek:

\[
(100 - 4X) - \frac{1}{2}(100 - 4X) = Remainder\;of\,Problems
\]
